Newsletter.Heading: Newsletter July 2012
Newsletter.Maindescription:
Less than three weeks remaining for the Olympic torch to complete its journey to Olympics venue at Stratford. The Olympic committee is busy doing its final preparations for holding a safe event. London is waiting to create so many new records. For those who were lucky enough to get tickets, we are confident you will enjoy.

Last weekend was a very hectic one for SIS as well (not as busy as the Olympics organising committee though). We had the annual SIS Cricket Galatta on Saturday and SIS July Satsang on Sunday. We take this opportunity to thank everyone who could make it for the event(s) and we are confident that you thoroughly enjoyed, despite the uncertain British weather. Photographs of the SIS Cricket Galatta are available on the website.

According to Tamil calendar, we will be entering into Dhakshinayana Punyakalam (Aadi month) on the 16th July. 1st day of Aadi is also celebrated as Aadi Pandigai. More information to follow in the next few weeks on the Sama Upakarma which is on the 24th of July, Varalakshmi Nonbu which falls on the 27th July, Yajur Upakarma on the 1st August and Rig Upakarma on the 2nd August.

SIS August Carnival - Saturday, the 18th of August VOLUNTEERS NEEDED

Contributing back to the society while having fun! How does it sound? Very interesting isn’t it? Yes. SIS will be holding a carnival where we are planning to have number of food stalls, mehandi stall, jewellery stalls, books, paintings, face painting, games and many more….. We guarantee that, it will be a perfect day out on a beautiful August afternoon where we as SIS family with our friends can contribute something back to the society while having food and fun.

Date: 18th August 2012
Time: 3 pm and 7 pm
Venue: St Andrews Church, 89 Malvern Avenue, Harrow, Middlesex, HA2 9ER
Entry: Free!

We invite volunteers:

  • To set-up Food Stalls. (SIS can reimburse the cost of base product)
  • You can donate Books (in good conditions)
  • You can donate Silk / designer Sarees (preferably brand new)
  • You can donate your holiday homes (for a week) or similar that can be sold on auction
  • Please feel free to come-up with ideas that will help to generate revenue

Please send an e-mail to sisnambalava@gmail.com and we will contact you directly.

This is an initiative with an intention to donate money to Shooting Star Children’s Hospice www.shootingstarchase.org.uk and Great Ormond Street Hospital www.gosh.org. All funds mobilised through the event will be contributed equally to the two organisations. We think this is a perfect way to pay something back to the society in which we live in this year when the Queen celebrates the Diamond Jubilee. We request you to make all sincere efforts to participate in this carnival and donate generously.

Here is the line-up of SIS events for the rest of the year. Apart from the monthly Satsang, we have lined-up number of interesting events for the rest of the year. E-mails will be sent and details will be made available on the website www.sisnambalava.org.uk, closer to the event.

18th Aug: SIS Carnival 2012
22nd Sep: SIS Career Event (Career guidance event to SIS youth)
20th Oct: SIS Musical Galatta
17th Nov: SIS Deepavali
15th Dec: SIS Youth Event (An event organised by SIS youth)

Please mark your calendar and we request you to participate in all the SIS events

The Website

The website www.sisnambalava.org.uk is being redesigned. The website with the new layout will be launched as soon as possible. We trust that the articles being published on the website are interesting and useful. We are encouraged by the number of hits that have gone up multi-fold. Please visit our website to read the articles and kindly let us know your views.

We welcome articles written by our members that are relevant to the objectives of SIS, ie, South Indian arts, culture and vedic religion and these will be uploaded after review by the editorial panel. Please feel free to ask for detailed guidelines.

Membership and Participation

South Indian Society as an organisation has come to shape with lots of hard work and contribution from several veterans of our community in this country. We sincerely thank each and every one who has contributed towards the growth of this organisation. This organisation runs for YOU and without YOUR involvement, contribution and participation it cannot succeed.
